No Bad Memories

Experiments → Raecyclopedia

For three weeks in 2017, I catalogued everything I looked up online and published it in a question-and-answer format to gain some insights into my own interests and self-teaching. This is an ongoing replication of that experiment, collecting what I've learned since January 1, 2021.

Art

  • What are some libraries or museums in the US that house Bruno Munari's work?
    Bruno Munari's work can be found at the Istituto Italiano di Cultura (NYC), Museum of Modern Art (NYC), Merrill-Berman Collection (NYC), Toledo Museum of Art, and Walker Art Center (Minneapolis).

Coding

  • Is there an app that lets me easily edit markdown files on GitHub from my phone?
    Yes (and it's oddly not the official GitHub app): Working Copy.

Cooking

  • What ingredients are typically found in dried ghormeh sabzi herb mix?
    Parsley, leek, and fenugreek are the key components of a dried ghormeh sabzi herb blend, with cilantro and/or spinach as less common additions.
  • What is ritual bread?
    It is a kind of ornately-decorated bread made for festivals or religious occasions in Eastern Europe.

Gardening

  • Do violets only bloom once?
    Violets bloom constantly, even after their blossoms have been harvested.
  • What is the best way to sprout pepper seeds indoors?
    When starting pepper plants indoors, soak the seeds first, then place them in sanitized containers of a soil-free, prepackaged starting mix to prevent the growth of fungus.
